intro: Leptasea vanbruntiae, commonly known as the Vanbrunt's leptasea, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pinkish flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
